channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Copenhagen is adapting to a warmer world with rain tunnels and 'sponge parks'
item.description: Copenhagen is expected to receive 30% more rainfall by the end of the century. The city is responding with a massive long-term adaptation plan.

item.title: RFK Jr. sent Congress 'medical disinformation' to defend COVID vaccine schedule change
item.description: A document circulated to members of Congress misinterprets studies and cites debunked research, scientists say. It could influence congressional perce...

item.title: A 2nd judge halts more of Trump's voting executive order
item.description: More than a month after a federal judge halted a key portion of President Trump's executive order on voting, another judge has ruled that additional p...

item.title: Why taking apart buildings piece by piece is a climate solution
item.description: Deconstruction is a growing approach to taking down homes that diverts waste from landfills, cuts carbon emissions and creates a circular economy for ...

item.title: House votes to claw back NPR funding. And, Trump keeps control of California Guard
item.description: The House has voted to claw back $1.1 billion in funding for public media. And, an appeals court blocked an earlier ruling ordering Trump to relinquis...

item.title: Major music festival pulls out of Serbia after backing student protests
item.description: The organisers have blamed 'undemocratic pressures' after authorities cut off funding.

item.title: As legal fight over Guard deployment plays out, Noem vows to continue Trump’s immigration crackdown
item.description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem is promising to move forward with the Trump administration’s immigration crackdown in Los Angeles despite the ...

item.title: 'I walked out of rubble': Survivor on how he escaped Air India wreckage
item.description: Mr Ramesh said he saw cabin crew members and passengers dying in front of his eyes.

item.title: Democratic candidates face off ahead of the Iowa caucus
item.description: Democratic candidates will square off in the last debate before the Iowa caucus. The last four Democratic caucus winners have gone on to win the party...

item.title: Flight dumps jet fuel over school playground
item.description: Hazmat teams are treating dozens of children and adults after a Delta flight heading to China dumped fuel over Los Angeles. The plane had just taken o...

item.title: How a family-run Cuban café in Miami is bringing its community together
item.description: Tinta y Café in Miami Shores serves Cuban-style cuisine. The family-run shop is bringing its community together, but has one specific rule – no Wi-Fi ...

item.title: Video shows Iranian missiles striking Ukrainian jet
item.description: New video has emerged, showing two Iranian missiles striking a Ukrainian jetliner last week. All 176 people on board died. David Martin has the latest...

item.title: Watch: Israel strikes targets across Iran as leaders vow to fight
item.description: Israel's prime minister said Iran's nuclear capability posed a "clear and present danger", while Iran's president promised a "powerful" response.

item.title: Survivor reported after Air India plane crashes
item.description: A passenger survived after an Air India plane crashed in the Indian city of Ahmedabad shortly after departing for London.

item.title: Trump administration gives personal data of immigrant Medicaid enrollees to deportation officials
Nigeria pardons activist Ken Saro-Wiwa 30 years after execution
item.description: The deaths of the environmentalist and eight other campaigners sparked an global outcry in 1995.

item.title: Who are the victims of the Air India plane crash?
item.description: Details are still emerging, but these are the people so far confirmed by the BBC to have died.

item.title: Appeals court temporarily blocks judge’s ruling to return control of National Guard to California
